homes_hear_details: Arkansas has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Arkansas Energy Office within the Arkansas Department of Energy and Environment is working on program design with the U.S. Department of Energy.
state_energy_office: Arkansas Energy Office, Department of Energy and Environment

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Arkansas, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Pulaski County (Little Rock), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $52,650.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Arkansas, 150% of Area Median Income in Pulaski County for a family of four is approximately $98,700.

net_metering: Arkansas has net metering rules established by the Arkansas Public Service Commission. Residential systems up to 25 kW qualify. Customers receive a credit at the full retail rate for excess generation. The 2-to-1 ratio (net metering capacity cannot exceed twice peak demand) requirement applies. Net metering was affirmed and modified under Act 464 of 2019.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Arkansas Department of Energy and Environment, Community Action Agencies
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair/replacement, duct sealing, water heater repair
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level.

programs.name: Entergy Solutions - HVAC Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for qualifying central AC or heat pump

programs.name: Low-Income Weatherization Program
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive weatherization including insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Varies by measure; up to $400 for heat pumps

programs.name: Residential Rebate Program
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR certified HVAC equipment, insulation, smart thermostats
